name: thedailybeast
text:
In Ep. 13 of The New Abnormal, Prof. @esglaude gives Rick and Molly his take on the George Floyd protests and what the black community needs—and doesn’t—from white people
https://t.co/FicWwE0fNm

name: thedailybeast
text:
Actress and singer Keke Palmer exhorted a National Guard unit to show their solidarity with anti-racism protesters by walking with them through the streets. 

The guardsmen refused to leave the street, but instead took a knee. https://t.co/sQqpDNRLsK

name: thedailybeast
text: After President Trump said he was prepared to send troops into cities across America, senior officials in the Pentagon began to try to distance themselves from the idea, underscoring that not one governor had requested additional military assistance https://t.co/eDSwjmMdDL

name: thedailybeast
text:
They came on foot and even on horseback. They clamored up trees to get a better view. They chanted “Say his name: George Floyd.” 

An estimated 60,000 people turned out in Houston to celebrate the life of George Floyd. https://t.co/CpjNU1nNwM

name: thedailybeast
text: "The photo-op was meaningless," writes @kpfallon of Trump's Monday photoshoot in front of St John's Church. "It sent no message. A booming message had been sent, however, when the words of his speech were juxtaposed with the violence he was stoking." https://t.co/eTEffY3MeI
